Sentence: We study the local optical response of the GaV 4 S 8 (111) surface in the ferroelectric phase below the Jahn-Teller tran- sition at T c = 42 K. Note that GaV 4 S 8 is optically anisotropic where the optical axes of the different domains are parallel to the 111 -type directions.
For GaV 4 S 8 , such a resonance in the near field occurs at around Î» = 31.7 Âµm resulting in an enhanced s-SNIM sig- nal as shown in Fig. (a) for a temperature of T s = 300 K.
In order to determine experimentally the local sample heating at the tip induced by the infrared laser, the Jahn-Teller transition in multiferroic GaV 4 S 8 is used.

Furthermore, we quantify the impact of local laser heating under the s-SNIM tip apex by monitoring the light-induced ferroelectric-to-paraelectric phase transi- tion of the skyrmion-hosting multiferroic material GaV 4 S 8 at T c = 42 K.
